main event: Three unidentified blue, metallic, disc-shaped objects were observed over Bellevue Hill, Vermont on April 29, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were described as being bluish in color, circular in shape, and traveling straight and level.
The objects appeared 20 degrees to the right of the observer's course, then reappeared 20 degrees to the left of the course.
The weather was clear with visibility (CAVU).
The report includes witness statements and a conclusion that the objects were not balloons or aircraft.
